content: A follow-up to IMHawker's earlier post: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/672198221/m/1110032022001 >http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/crime/article6061914.ece?token=null&offset=12&page=2 The power of the media was demonstrated yesterday after a high level MI5 officer showed up for a briefing at Downing St. The de rigeur photos of his arrival were on the wire around the world in minutes. Problem is he was carrying a sheaf of dossiers and an exposed printed sheet. That sheet bore the outline of a proposed security action against a terrorist cell in Manchester. Once it was out there, police had no choice than to move up their operation,which they did, or scrub it. The officer has been asked to step down. This message has been edited. Last edited by: popsiq, Thu 09 April 2009 05:30 AM
reply: A follow-up to IMHawker's earlier post: http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/672198221/m/1110032022001 >http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/crime/article6061914.ece?token=null&offset=12&page=2 The power of the media was demonstrated yesterday after a high level MI5 officer showed up for a briefing at Downing St. The de rigeur photos of his arrival were on the wire around the world in minutes. Problem is he was carrying a sheaf of dossiers and an exposed printed sheet. That sheet bore the outline of a proposed security action against a terrorist cell in Manchester. Once it was out there, police had no choice than to move up their operation,which they did, or scrub it. The officer has been asked to step down. This message has been edited. title: Brit 'Outs' AQ Operation

content: I don't think he was asked to resign I think Quick jacked it of his own volition, which makes hime something frankly unheard of in British public life these days - an honourable man.
